Bash(gh pr create --title "fix\(perf\): prevent result card flashing during scroll on large lists" --body "$\(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary
- Wrap card components \(ResultCard, DrugCard, TrialCard, CategorySection\) with `React.memo\(\)` to prevent unnecessary re-renders
- Add `hasMounted` ref pattern to prevent CSS animations from replaying on re-renders
- Track already-animated results in SearchResults to allow new results \(Load More\) to animate while preventing re-animation of existing results
- Replace `transition-all` with specific properties \(`transform`, `box-shadow`, `border-color`\) for better CSS performance
- Fix TrialCard location key from array index to composite key for stable React reconciliation

## Problem
ICD-10 result cards flash white and disappear/reappear when scrolling through large result sets \(87+ cards, e.g., Musculoskeletal chapter\). This was caused by:
1. Missing `React.memo` on card components leading to full re-renders
2. CSS animations replaying on every render
3. Heavy components \(ResultCard is ~1000 lines with internal state\)

## Testing
- [ ] Search "musculoskeletal" to get 87+ results
- [ ] Scroll rapidly up and down - verify no white flashing
- [ ] Expand drugs on a card, scroll away, scroll back - verify expansion state preserved
- [ ] Click "Load More" - verify new cards animate, existing cards don''t
- [ ] Toggle favorites - verify only the affected card re-renders

## Technical Details
- Build passes successfully
- All existing functionality preserved \(drug expansion, trial expansion, favorites, Load More\)
